Content.p: Title: Mobile Delta Submerged Aquatic Vegetation Survey 1994
Abstract: This dataset consists of polygons generated to represent areas of submerged aquatic vegetation in the Mobile Delta that were present in 1987.

Purpose: These data were compiled to provide the Alabama Department of Conservation of Natural Resources with historical submerged vegetation polygons. This theme was created for coastal management purposes in partial fulfillment of a grant from the Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources State Lands Division, Grant #GSA-CZM-308-08-2. Funding for this project was provided by the Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources, State Lands Division, Coastal Section (ADCNR-Coastal), in part, by a grant from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Office of Ocean and Coastal Resource Management, Award No. NA04NOS4191091.
Access_Constraints: For restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing this data set, contact the Geological Survey of Alabama (see Point_of_Contact).
Data should not be used at a scale larger than 1:100,000.

Reproduction or redistribution of digital data sets or products derived therefrom to a third party organization or entity is expressly forbidden. None of these data shall be electronically duplicated on magnetic or optical media for use by others, in whole or in part, without permission of the Geological Survey of Alabama.

Any hardcopies utilizing these datasets shall clearly indicate their source. If the user has modified the data in any way, user is obligated to describe the types of modifications performed on the hardcopy map. User specifically agrees not to misrepresent these datasets, nor to imply that changes made were approved by the Geological Survey of Alabama (GSA).

The GSA should be acknowledged as the originator of the data. This dataset is to be used as a primary reference source. This is public information and may be interpreted by organizations, agencies, units of government, or others based on needs; however, they are responsible for the appropriate application. Federal, State, or local regulatory bodies are not to reassign to the originators any authority for the decisions they make.

Photographic or digital enlargement of these maps to scales greater than that at which they were originally delineated can cause misrepresentation of the data. If enlarged, the maps will not include the fine detail that would be appropriate for mapping at the large scale. Digital data files are periodically updated. Files are dated, and user is responsible for obtaining the latest version of the data.

Data_Set_Credit: The Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources created this dataset with the help of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Mobile District. The Tennessee Valley Authority contributed the Aerial Imagery.
Native_Data_Set_Environment: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.2 (Build 3790) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770
Attribute_Accuracy_Report: Data digitized for use at a scale of 1:100,000.

Completeness_Report: Completeness of this dataset is a reflection of the source material. Polygons denoting emergent marsh, open water, forested, or clear areas were not digitized as requested by the ADCNR.
Originator: Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources, Game and Fish Division
Title: Mobile Delta Aquatic Plant Survey
Publisher: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers

Source_Contribution: This project was completed as a portion of the aquatic plant control program, a cooperative program between the Alabama Department of Natural Resources and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Mobile District.
Originator: Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources
Title: Mobile Delta Aquatic Plant Survey
Publisher: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers

Source_Contribution: This project was completed as a portion of the aquatic plant control program, a cooperative program between the Alabama Department of Natural Resources and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Mobile District.
Originator: Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources
Title: Mobile Delta Aquatic Plant Survey
Publisher: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
Source_Contribution: The Tennessee Valley Authority contributed the Aerial Imagery for this project.
Process_Description: Data were digitized from existing digital map from a paper map scan by the ADCNR.
Process_Description: Raster dataset was georeferenced and used to create a polygon layer and its attributes.
Process_Description: Several fields were added to the attribute table.
Unrepresentable_Domain: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Attribute_Definition: Polygon number used for labeling.
Attribute_Definition: Minor submerged aquatic vegetation type.
Attribute_Definition: Major submerged aquatic vegetation type.
Attribute_Definition: Area of each polygon in units of meters squared.
Attribute_Definition: Perimeter of each polygon in units of meters.
Attribute_Definition: Area of each polygon in units of acres.
Attribute_Definition: name of waterway; field provided but not attributed.
Attribute_Definition: Major and minor submerged vegetation types (combined for labeling purposes).

Geological Survey of Alabama (GSA) provides these geographic data "as is." GSA makes no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of information contained in the geographic data. GSA further makes no warranties, either expressed or implied ,as to any other matter whatsoever, including, without limitation, the condition of the product or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. Although these data have been processed successfully on computers of GSA, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by GSA regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.

In no event shall the GSA have any liability whatsoever for payment of any consequential, incidental, indirect, special, or tort damages of any kind, including, but not limited to, any loss of profits arising out of use of or reliance on the geographic data or arising out of the delivery, installation, operation, or support by GSA.
Metadata_Standard_Name: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
